colors.name: Cosmic Orange
colors.description: Bold, fluorescent orange with warm undertones. A striking departure from traditional Pro colors.
colors.notes: First vibrant color for Pro models in years. May also be described as 'Dark Gold' or 'Copper'.

colors.name: Deep Blue
colors.description: Rich, deep blue similar to Mood Indigo (Pantone 19-4025 TPG). Professional and sophisticated.
colors.notes: Replaces the lighter blues from previous generations. Similar to Blue Titanium but adapted for aluminum.

colors.name: Silver
colors.description: Classic silver metallic finish. Clean, professional, and timeless.
colors.notes: Staple color for Pro models.

colors.name: Black
colors.description: Very dark gray, nearly black. Classic and understated.
colors.notes: Not pure black, more of a dark charcoal gray.

colors.name: White
colors.description: Clean, bright white with subtle warmth.
colors.notes: Timeless, minimalist choice.

colors.name: Lavender
colors.description: Light purple/lavender shade, darker than iPhone 14's purple.
colors.notes: Returns after being replaced by pink in iPhone 15/16.

colors.name: Light Blue
colors.description: Soft, pastel blue similar to iPhone 15 Blue but slightly richer.
colors.notes: Softer than Ultramarine, more saturated than iPhone 15.

colors.name: Sage
colors.description: Muted green with gray undertones.
colors.notes: Subtle, natural-looking green.

colors.name: Steel Gray
colors.description: Medium gray with cool undertones.
colors.notes: Modern take on Space Gray. Availability may vary.

colors.name: Sky Blue
colors.description: Light, airy blue - lighter than iPhone 17's blue. Matches M4 MacBook Air.
colors.notes: Designed to emphasize the lightness of the device (145g, 5.5mm thin).

colors.name: Gardenia
colors.description: Soft cream/beige color, lighter version of Desert Titanium.
colors.notes: Warm, elegant neutral tone.

colors.name: Black
colors.description: Classic black finish.
colors.notes: Standard option.

colors.name: White
colors.description: Pure white finish.
colors.notes: Clean, minimalist option.

colors.name: Black
colors.description: Deep, almost-black shade. Sleek and professional.
colors.notes: Very similar to iPhone 15 Black.

colors.name: White
colors.description: Warm white, elegant and simple.
colors.notes: Not offered on iPhone 15, making a return.

colors.name: Pink
colors.description: Bright, vibrant pink - bolder than iPhone 15's soft pink.
colors.notes: Most eye-catching color. Very different from previous years' pastels.

colors.name: Teal
colors.description: Deep teal/aqua green, more saturated than iPhone 15 Green.
colors.notes: Perfect for water/beach aesthetic. Avoids being too green.

colors.name: Ultramarine
colors.description: Deep, vibrant blue - much bolder than iPhone 15 Blue.
colors.notes: Most popular new color. Deep sea/indigo vibe.

colors.name: Black Titanium
colors.description: Darker than iPhone 15 Pro's Black Titanium. Nearly pure black.
colors.notes: New Grade 5 titanium makes it darker than previous generation.

colors.name: Natural Titanium
colors.description: Light gray, cleaner looking than iPhone 15 Pro version.
colors.notes: Most popular neutral option. Lighter than previous gen.

colors.name: White Titanium
colors.description: Brighter white with cooler undertones than iPhone 15 Pro.
colors.notes: Cleaner, more refined than previous White Titanium.

colors.name: Desert Titanium
colors.description: Beige-gold variant with warm tones. Signature color for 16 Pro.
colors.notes: Replaces Blue Titanium. Warmer frame contrasts with softer back.

colors.name: Midnight
colors.description: Very dark blue-black finish with anodized aluminum.
colors.notes: Most popular color. Deep, rich finish. May show fingerprints.

colors.name: Starlight
colors.description: Champagne gold/rose gold with warm undertones.
colors.notes: Warm, elegant neutral. Similar to rose gold but more subdued.

colors.name: Silver
colors.description: Classic silver aluminum finish.
colors.notes: Traditional Mac color. Professional and timeless.

colors.name: Sky Blue
colors.description: NEW 2025! Metallic light blue, similar to iPhone 17 Air's Sky Blue.
colors.notes: First appearance: March 2025. Not as bright as iMac's blue.

colors.name: Space Black
colors.description: Deep black/dark gray finish.
colors.notes: Professional, modern finish. Available in standard and nano-texture glass.

colors.name: Silver
colors.description: Bright silver aluminum finish.
colors.notes: Classic iPad Pro color. Available in standard and nano-texture glass.

apple_naming_patterns.pro_devices: Tend to use material names (Titanium, Space Black) or minimal descriptors
apple_naming_patterns.consumer_devices: Use more creative, evocative names (Cosmic Orange, Ultramarine, Sky Blue)
apple_naming_patterns.recent_trends: Apple moving toward bolder colors after years of muted pastels (2024-2025)

material_finishes.aluminum: Used in MacBook Air, iPhone 17 series, standard iPhones
material_finishes.titanium: Premium material for iPhone Pro models (2023-2024)
material_finishes.glass: Used for iPhone backs, available in glossy and nano-texture

iphone.pro_evolution: Moved from stainless steel to titanium (2023), then aluminum (2025)

macbook.discontinued_2025: Space Gray replaced by Sky Blue in M4 Air
macbook.color_consistency: Midnight, Starlight, Silver remain across generations

ipad.pro_minimalism: iPad Pro keeps only 2 colors (Space Black, Silver)
ipad.air_variety: iPad Air offers more color options

hex_color_notes.disclaimer: Hex values are approximate representations based on official images and descriptions. Actual colors may vary based on lighting, display calibration, and manufacturing variations.
hex_color_notes.material_impact: Aluminum, titanium, and glass finishes reflect light differently, affecting perceived color.
hex_color_notes.best_practices: Always reference official Apple product images for the most accurate color representation.

usage_recommendations.for_ecommerce: Use official color names in product listings
usage_recommendations.for_design: Reference hex codes as starting points, adjust based on material
usage_recommendations.for_inventory: Include year and model for color disambiguation (e.g., 'Silver iPhone 16 Pro' vs 'Silver MacBook Air M4')
